title: What were the Wimbledon results?
description: Wimbledon began on Monday when Carlos Alcaraz kickstarted his quest for a three-peat at the grass-court major. The Spaniard survived an opening-round scare, needing five sets to oust Fabio Fognini. Several seeded players were upset, including eighth seed Holger Rune and ninth seed Daniil Medvedev. View some of Monday's key results from the All England Club below and click here to see all scores. Centre Court Carlos Alcaraz (ESP) d. Fabio Fognini (ITA) 7-5, 6-7(5), 7-5, 2-6, 6-1 Katie Boulter (GBR) d. Paula Badosa (ESP) 6-2, 3-6, 6-4 Alexander Zverev (GER) and Arthur Rinderknech (FRA) to be completed: 6-7(3), 7-6(8) No. 1 Court Aryna Sabalenka d. Carson Branstine (CAN) 6-1, 7-5 Joao Fonseca (BRA) d. Jacob Fearnley (GBR) 6-4, 6-1, 7-6(5) Emma Raducanu (GBR) d. Mimi Xu (GBR) 6-3, 6-3 Taylor Fritz (USA) and Giovanni Mpetshi Perricard (FRA) to be completed: 6-7(6), 6-7(8), 6-4, 7-6(6) Read More from Wimbledon: Mpetshi Perricard shatters tournament's serve-speed record Alcaraz aids stricken fan as brutal heat hits on Day 1 Fognini's farewell? Teary Fabio ponders future after Alcaraz five-setter 'Fragile' Tsitsipas 'absolutely left with no answers' [NEWSLETTER FORM]
excerpt: View the Wimbledon results and read news from the grass-court major.

html:
Wimbledon

Alcaraz wins five-setter over Fognini; Medvedev, Rune among upsets

June 30, 2025

Ezra Shaw/Getty Images

Wimbledon main-draw action runs until 13 July. By ATP Staff

Wimbledon began on Monday when Carlos Alcaraz kickstarted his quest for a three-peat at the grass-court major. The Spaniard survived an opening-round scare, needing five sets to oust Fabio Fognini.

Several seeded players were upset, including eighth seed Holger Rune and ninth seed Daniil Medvedev.

View some of Monday's key results from the All England Club below and click here to see all scores.

Centre Court
Carlos Alcaraz (ESP) d. Fabio Fognini (ITA) 7-5, 6-7(5), 7-5, 2-6, 6-1
Katie Boulter (GBR) d. Paula Badosa (ESP) 6-2, 3-6, 6-4
Alexander Zverev (GER) and Arthur Rinderknech (FRA) to be completed: 6-7(3), 7-6(8)

No. 1 Court
Aryna Sabalenka d. Carson Branstine (CAN) 6-1, 7-5
Joao Fonseca (BRA) d. Jacob Fearnley (GBR) 6-4, 6-1, 7-6(5)
Emma Raducanu (GBR) d. Mimi Xu (GBR) 6-3, 6-3
Taylor Fritz (USA) and Giovanni Mpetshi Perricard (FRA) to be completed: 6-7(6), 6-7(8), 6-4, 7-6(6)
